body: This was something I thought would be cool for reddit but it also applies here. Instead of having one set of mods for everybody on each guild, why not have no global mods at all, and instead each user can pick who they want to mod Ruqqus for them. When those mods remove something, it gets removed only for the users who picked them. Users could also perform these actions themselves. This should include admin actions such as banning users and subreddits. Maybe Ruqqus should even become completely decentralized like notabug is. This would include not using Discord anymore because these ideas are not possible there. This would remove all of reddit's flaws regarding mods, thus permanently solving the powermod problem. The only things that would need actual deletion then is the admins removing illegal content.

body: Actually the goal of this is to make Ruqqus the opposite of Reddit. Reddit uses mandatory mods for everyone, resulting in censorship. Ruqqus also currently uses that setup. It should be changed so if you don't want any mods at all, you don't have any mods. And if you want a ton of mods to make everything only what you want to see, go for it. That way no one can complain, and a powermod cabal can't exist.

body: I posted it to the first one, but I'm not using +BetaFeedback as it seems to be yet another place where the admins are promoting the Discord mods as guildmasters in the official parts of Ruqqus. Which would also be resolved with my idea. As it stands now the power user cabal could easily form and with this recent development I think it already is starting. I warned the admins that this would happen if they didn't fix their faulty mod recruiting system but for some reason they flip out if you ask them about it. The mods they chose are very good users, but I feel like this could become another DefaultMods (as the admins refuse to even consider anyone else for positions of authority, and the current mods know about as much as we do as to why). Unfortunately it looks like Ruqqus will go down the same path as reddit did in the future. I feel like my suggestion here is the only way this could possibly be prevented, because the current systems of Ruqqus and Reddit are authoritarian and corrupted way too easily (even though Ruqqus doesn't act authoritarian with it right now, they still hold absolute power).

When those mods remove something, it gets removed only for the users who picked them. Users could also perform these actions themselves. This should include admin actions such as banning users and subreddits. Maybe Ruqqus should even become completely decentralized like notabug is. This would include not using Discord anymore because these ideas are not possible there. This would remove all of reddit's flaws regarding mods, thus permanently solving the powermod problem. The only things that would need actual deletion then is the admins removing illegal content.
post.title: Everyone should be able to personally choose who mods Ruqqus for them.

body:
I found out more about the +BetaFeedback one. Apparently the Discord mod and an admin came up with the idea in the Discord server.

I'm still seeing a pattern emerging here where the admins give the Discord mods more of the inside scoop, while telling everyone else "we don't care about what you think and you have no right to give your input so fuck off!" with anything having to do with how Ruqqus is being run. Seeing what's happened over the past few weeks, I doubt the admins would've taken the idea seriously coming from someone who wasn't a Discord mod, let alone make them a guildmaster of an "official" guild even if they did hear the idea.

It *was* confirmed earlier that the mods were added based on suggestions from users in the Discord server, not just the admins' friends, however what probably happened is that the admins got to know the mods more after that. They have a private modding channel with each other and one of the mods mentioned that the admins actually send them DMs so this is probably the case. The admins need to fix this, if there's going to be any mods at all it can't be impossible to become one like on reddit, especially looking at these implications that come with it. If they don't it will turn into a DefaultMods if it hasn't already. Right now the mods can be trusted but the setup is still stupid and prone to forming an admin clique, which seemingly already exists, and that will lead exactly to where reddit and digg ended up in a few years from now.
